words.defineEn: a wooden instrument of punishment on a post with holes for the wrists and neck; offenders were locked in and so exposed to public scorn
words.defineVi: một dụng cụ trừng phạt bằng gỗ trên một cây cột có lỗ để xỏ cổ tay và cổ; những kẻ phạm tội đã bị nhốt và bị phơi bày trước sự khinh bỉ của công chúng

examples: In the 18th century armies usually fed themselves by foraging, which really meant just pillaging the countryside.
But, with everyone following that logic, the finite resource gets pillaged.
Life within the Mongol Empire wasn't just war, pillage and destruction.
And maybe, you know, in five centuries or so, begin to pillage.
Founded four centuries ago, the town's narrow streets and position high atop a hill once made it difficult for invaders to pillage.
words.defineVi: trộm hàng; lấy làm chiến lợi phẩm

examples: Pippa's absence went unnoticed.
He tried to make an excuse for his absence from the meeting.
She had always idealized the romantic notion of a long-distance relationship, but the reality of their separation proved that absence is the mother of disillusion.
However, the absence of an effective social security system meant that the government's response to these problems was for all intents and purposes non-existent.
He made up for his absence by bringing her a gift.
words.defineEn: the state of not being at a place or with a person when it is expected of one
words.defineVi: tình trạng không ở một nơi hoặc với một người khi người ta mong đợi một người

examples: Still, this doesn't absolve others of their responsibility.
The nursing home industry was going state to state to try to absolve themselves of liability.

Not capitalizing it, in other words, makes it seem like less of an identity or a culture, and thus absolves white people from having to think of their actions in the collective like so many nonwhite communities are pushed to do.
words.defineEn: to release someone from blame, guilt, or obligation, clearing them of any wrongdoing
words.defineVi: để giải phóng ai đó khỏi sự đổ lỗi, tội lỗi hoặc nghĩa vụ, xóa cho họ bất kỳ hành vi sai trái nào

examples: The author abstracted key themes from the novel in her literary analysis.
The scientist abstracted the data from various sources to analyze trends.
The professor delivered a lecture on abstract mathematics, exploring complex theories and formulas.
The scientist presented an abstract theory that revolutionized our understanding of the universe.
The film incorporated abstract imagery and surreal elements to convey the protagonist's inner emotional journey.
words.defineEn: consider apart from a particular case or instance
words.defineVi: xem xét ngoài một trường hợp hoặc trường hợp cụ thể

words.defineEn: difficult to penetrate; incomprehensible to one of ordinary understanding or knowledge
words.defineVi: khó thâm nhập; không thể hiểu được đối với một người có hiểu biết hoặc kiến thức thông thường

examples: So in this case we had an improper integral.
I just wrote this improper fraction as a mixed number.
This is as an improper fraction.
Let's convert this to an improper fraction.
So many people think rabbits eat carrots because of Bugs Bunny and it has led to pet rabbits getting seriously improper diets.
words.defineEn: unfit for a particular person, thing, or situation
words.defineVi: không thích hợp cho một người cụ thể, điều, hoặc tình hình
không thận trọng hay khôn ngoan

words.defineEn: rude and with a lack of respect towards others, especially the elderly
words.defineVi: thô lỗ và thiếu tôn trọng người khác, đặc biệt là người lớn tuổi

words.defineEn: powerlessness revealed by an inability to act
words.defineVi: bất lực bộc lộ bởi không có khả năng hành động

words.defineEn: not capable of being carried out or put into practice
words.defineVi: không có khả năng được thực hiện hoặc đưa vào thực tế

examples: Why is that impolitic or impolite?
When we were in the company of other journalists, her question was always the one that just kind of cut through the fog and sometimes was a little impolitic.
But the piece de resistance, of course, is the monument, which Robert Shure and his team have been conserving for months.
words.defineEn: the most important dish of a meal
words.defineVi: món ăn quan trọng nhất trong bữa ăn

examples: And then states have sort of pieced it up piecemeal.

So there were a few things happening, but it was fairly piecemeal, and it wasn't really product-related.
I mean, there's lots of stuff that you've got ta piecemeal together.
words.defineEn: a little bit at a time
words.defineVi: một chút tại một thời điểm

examples: Weyler’s tenure in Cuba had deadly consequences, not just for the Cuban people but for the world.
But Palmer's tenure was marked by troubles.
Their brief tenure is well-documented in Bavarian government records, the still-active Freemasons’s records, and particularly the overlap between these two sources, without a whisper since.
During his tenure from 1877 to 1911, the High Court enshrined racial segregation in American life.
Benzion Netanyahu did not get tenure at the Hebrew University as a historian.
words.defineVi: cung cấp việc làm suốt đời cho

examples: Things are tenuous.
Restaurant businesses and food businesses are very tenuous.
As remnants expand and age they become more tenuous.
So, the evidence so far is kinda tenuous, and we’ll need a lot more research before we know for sure.

Most of what we can study about Slavic spirits now comes from materials recorded in the nineteenth century when urbanization and advances in science and education made belief in the supernatural tenuous.
words.defineVi: rất tinh tế, chảy nước, hoặc mỏng

examples: Stories of child kidnappings by gangs are rampant.

Disease was rampant.

words.defineEn: behaving in an unrestrained or unchecked manner, often to the point of being reckless or aggressive
words.defineVi: cư xử một cách không kiềm chế hoặc không được kiểm soát, thường đến mức liều lĩnh hoặc hung hăng

examples: And at the edges, there are ejecta ramparts.

words.defineEn: a defensive wall or embankment built around a fortification or city for protection against enemy attacks
